item.title: Software Idioms You Should Know
item.description: I have been working as a software engineer for just over five years. Every now and then I encounter an idiom during a meeting which I don’t understand at all and it is not explained because it is assumed that everyone already understands its meaning. Either everyone else does know what it means or there are a number of people like me, confused but hesitant to ask what it means as it is hard to gauge whether you are the only dumb-dumb who does not know.
